poem:
**At the Garden's Echo**

In the dim hum of Madison Square Garden,  
where banners flap like pages of tabloid prose,  
a river of red hats flows, eager and buoyant,  
swirling in the echoes of a broad-chested voice.  
Reporters jot in notebooks,  
as history entwines with fiction,  
a carnival of conviction in the morning glow.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "News Corp’s The Australian pitches itself firmly in Trump tent at Madison Square Garden rally | Weekly Beast The Australian’s Washington correspondent, Adam Creighton, was at least upfront about where his publication stands when he filed his report for Monday’s paper from Donald Trump’s rally in Madison Square Garden By 10.30am local time at least 3,000 supporters, including The Australian, were lined up to enter what will be remembered as the signature Trump rally, which". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
